DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study evaluate effect method delivery ( vaginal delivery vs. cesarean section ) oxygen saturation first postpartum night . The investigator hypothesize nocturnal desaturation occur frequently cesarean section compare vaginal delivery , express either duration SpO2 90 % Oxygen Desaturation Index ( ODI ) . The ODI define number oxygen desaturations least 3 % per hour . Furthermore , investigator expect high pulse rate lower mean minimum SpO2 cesarean section group compare vaginal delivery group . The secondary aim study investigate upper body position sleep ( 45 degree elevate vs. non-elevated ) affect oxygen saturation first postpartum night . The investigator hypothesize upper body elevation 45 degree decrease incidence desaturation event , express either duration SpO2 90 % ODI , compare non-elevated body position within delivery group ( vaginal delivery cesarean section ) . The third aim study identify independent predictor nocturnal desaturation postpartum woman . To end , investigator administer questionnaire collect demographic clinical data accord various obstructive sleep apnea screen score , include P-SAP , STOP-Bang , Epworth Sleepiness Scale . The investigator also ask patient rate pain study night verbal numerical rating scale .
DOC.brief_title: Determination Predictors Nocturnal Desaturation Postpartum Women
DOC.detailed_description: Sleep-disordered breathing common pregnancy , persist early postpartum period . Postpartum airway obstruction main cause anesthesia-related maternal death North America . Upper airway edema follow labor delivery may impair pharyngeal anatomy , lead increase vulnerability airway collapse sleep . This study evaluate whether kind delivery ( vaginal birth versus cesarean section ) effect nocturnal desaturation first night delivery . Furthermore , investigator examine upper body position sleep effect occurrence oxygen desaturation . In addition , investigator evaluate preexist condition , indicate high P-SAP STOP-Bang-score increase likelihood nocturnal desaturation .
DOC.criteria: Postpartum mother within 24 hour delivery Age 18 year . Admitted Massachusetts General Hospital OB service delivery . Interventions randomly assign patient enrol study 1 Age 18 year
